full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
**Title:** Metal Fabrication and Drawing Creation for Log Lifter

**Reference Number:** WS4151557459-Doc4221504220

**Solicitation Number:** WS4151557459

**Announcement Date:** September 20, 2023

**Tender Closing Date:** September 25, 2023, 2:00 PM EDT (Note: please disregard any Ariba Discovery posting response deadline or CanadaBuys posting closing time. The actual tender closing time is 2:00 PM, but bid submissions must be received by September 25, 2023, 14:00 EDT. Any late bid submissions will be declared non-responsive.)

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is seeking a contract for the metal fabrication and drawing creation of log lifters in accordance with the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA) and the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement.

**Contract Overview:**

- **Contract Value:** N/A
- **Contract Start Date:** September 20, 2023
- **Contract End Date:** June 30, 2024

**Procurement Details:**

- **Contract Type:** Goods (Fabricated structural assemblies)
- **Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price
- **Bidding Method:** Competitive Open Bidding

**Requirements:**

- **Fabrication of Metal Components:** Designs should be created and manufactured in accordance with Parks Canada Agency (PC) specifications.
- **Drawing Creation:** Comprehensive drawings for each fabricated metal component are required.

**Tender Documents:** Please visit [https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17503110](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17503110) (External link to Discovery - Sourcing cloud)

**Point of Contact:**

- **Name:** Stanley Chui
- **Email:** stanley.chui@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
- **Phone:** N/A

**Language:** English, French

Please note that this notice supersedes the previous version dated August 17, 2023, with a closing of September 25, 2023 at 2:00 PM EDT.

I rewrote your output by using proper grammar in English, and marked the bold area, excluded lines that were not relevant to the prompt, included a summary of the contract requirements to make it more clear. I also crossed out the "exp" marking. 
The text now follows the general structure of official government documents used
